scenarios.name: Asking for Directions
scenarios.description: Ask how to get to a landmark
scenarios.cultural_note: Italians are generally very helpful with directions, and will often walk with you part of the way!

dialogue_flow.speaker: tourist
expected_patterns: Mi scusi, dove si trova la stazione
hints: Use 'dov'√®' (where is) or 'dove si trova' (where is located)

dialogue_flow.speaker: local
dialogue_flow.text_italian: La stazione? Vada sempre dritto, poi giri a sinistra.
dialogue_flow.text_english: The station? Go straight ahead, then turn left.
dialogue_flow.audio_hint: VA-da SEM-pre DRIT-to po-i JI-ri a si-NIS-tra

dialogue_flow.speaker: local
dialogue_flow.text_english: You're welcome! Have a good day!

scenarios.name: Shopping for Clothes
scenarios.description: Buy a piece of clothing at a shop
scenarios.cultural_note: In Italian shops, it's polite to greet the staff when entering, even if you're just browsing.

dialogue_flow.speaker: shopkeeper
dialogue_flow.text_english: Good morning! Can I help you?

dialogue_flow.speaker: shopkeeper
dialogue_flow.text_english: What size do you wear?

dialogue_flow.speaker: shopkeeper
dialogue_flow.text_italian: Ecco, queste sono molto belle. Vuole provarle?
dialogue_flow.text_english: Here, these are very beautiful. Would you like to try them on?

scenarios.name: Ordering at a Restaurant
scenarios.cultural_note: Italians typically order: antipasto (appetizer), primo (first course - pasta/risotto), secondo (main - meat/fish), and dolce (dessert).

dialogue_flow.speaker: waiter
dialogue_flow.text_english: Good evening! Have you already chosen?

dialogue_flow.speaker: diner
expected_patterns: S√¨, per primo vorrei la pasta

dialogue_flow.speaker: waiter
dialogue_flow.text_english: Excellent choice! And for the main course?

dialogue_flow.speaker: waiter
dialogue_flow.text_english: Perfect! And to drink?

scenarios.name: Checking into a Hotel
scenarios.description: Check in at your hotel reservation
scenarios.cultural_note: Hotels in Italy often require your passport for registration. Have it ready!

dialogue_flow.speaker: receptionist
dialogue_flow.text_english: Good morning! Do you have a reservation?

dialogue_flow.speaker: guest

scenarios.name: Making a Phone Reservation
scenarios.description: Call to reserve a table at a restaurant
scenarios.cultural_note: Phone etiquette in Italy: always introduce yourself with 'Sono...' (I am...) or 'Mi chiamo...' (My name is...).

dialogue_flow.speaker: restaurant_staff
dialogue_flow.text_english: Hello, Da Vinci Restaurant, good evening!

dialogue_flow.speaker: caller
hints: Use 'vorrei prenotare' (I would like to reserve)

dialogue_flow.speaker: restaurant_staff
dialogue_flow.text_italian: Certo! Per quante persone e per quando?
dialogue_flow.text_english: Of course! For how many people and for when?
dialogue_flow.audio_hint: CHER-to per KWAN-te per-SO-ne e per KWAN-do

dialogue_flow.speaker: caller
expected_patterns: Per due persone, domani sera alle otto
hints: State number of people: 'per due/tre/quattro persone'
Give day and time: 'domani/sabato alle otto'

dialogue_flow.speaker: restaurant_staff
dialogue_flow.text_english: Perfect! Under what name?

scenarios.name: At the Pharmacy
scenarios.description: Ask for medicine at a pharmacy
scenarios.cultural_note: Italian pharmacists are highly trained and can often provide medical advice for minor ailments.

dialogue_flow.speaker: pharmacist
dialogue_flow.text_english: Good morning! How can I help you?

dialogue_flow.speaker: customer
expected_patterns: Cerco qualcosa per il mal di testa
hints: 'Ho mal di...' means 'I have a pain in...'
Common: mal di testa (headache), mal di stomaco (stomach ache)

dialogue_flow.speaker: pharmacist
dialogue_flow.text_italian: Le consiglio questo antidolorifico. Ne prenda una ogni sei ore.
dialogue_flow.text_english: I recommend this painkiller. Take one every six hours.

dialogue_flow.speaker: customer
hints: Ask 'Quanto costa?' (How much does it cost?)

dialogue_flow.speaker: pharmacist
dialogue_flow.text_english: It's eight euros and fifty cents.

dialogue_flow.speaker: customer
hints: Accept with 'Va bene' (That's fine) and thank them
